title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: It was very Slow-paced but the process wasn't difficult for me to engage with. I believe this is generally typical for this particular organization. It may be helpful if you know someone within the organization.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: Project Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was straightforward. The questions were related to the role. The hiring team seemed pleasant. The background check was quick. No difficulties encountered. The process altogether took about two months.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to make a transition?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very structured. It was a comfortable setting. They conversation was great which made it now feel like an interview. It was a very enjoyable process. I would recommend to anyone.
Interview Questions: What’s one thing you bring to the table ?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: Very Professional, on time, and down to earth. There were two interviewers who came off very understanding and knowledgeable about the job. They were also funny which made the process less stressful and more personal.
Interview Questions: Tell us a little about yourself?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine in Dec 2020
Interview Descriptions: The interview process only took 15 mins.  Make sure you ask the right questions to determine if the company is good fit for you. You are interviewing them as well.
Interview Questions:
They asked the typical questions...
Tell me about yourself. Explain your experience as it relates to the position...

title: Administrative Director to EVP and Dean Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: Unorganized and untimely from the very beginning. Applied in September 2017, contacted bu recruiter via email January 2018, replied and didn't connect again until February 2018. First interview with senior management so no opportunity to speak with HR about basic information. Technical difficulties with video interview because they did not take the time to troubleshoot before interview started.

title: Administrative Assistant I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted by the department in which the position was available directly within a month-month and a half. Only one interview was required with the Department Administrator and the Program Director for which the position was housed in (future interviews will probably include the Program Manager as well). The interview lasted approximately 1 hour. A month later, I was contacted with an offer from Human Resources via phone for a verbal offer and the official offer was in a letter. The salary offer first appeared in the letter.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for MSM/this program/this department?

title: Research Fellow/Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very informal. Wasn't ask to present my research which was very odd. I wasn't able to speak to other post docs in the lab (red flag). A lot of student were also unavailable for me to speak with as well. The PI wasn't honest about his intention bringing me into the lab.

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a pretty routine process.  Interview was with a panel, held over Skype. I remember there were a few behavioral questions thrown in to which my answers were brief. I regret that I was not invited to tour campus prior to coming on-board.
Interview Questions: Interview was held more than four years ago.  I have forgotten specific questions, but they were not difficult at all as I am not an ace interviewee. In hindsight, I did not ask enough questions about their expectations nor did I get enough information about how I would be evaluated.

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by a three person panel. The interview lasted more than an hour. It was grueling. There was a question I thought I answered but was asked more than once.  I'm not sure if they thought there was another answer I could provide but that was mine and there was nothing deeper.
Interview Questions: What mistake have you made and how did you handle it ?

title: Lead Accounts Receivable Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: There were three rounds of interviews.  First I met with the recruiter, then I met with the Accounting Manager and then the rest of the staff that I work with.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for our company

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: very simple and not stressful. There interview was before a panel of 2 faculty members. I was asked questions about my back ground and why I became interested in pursuing the current position.
Interview Questions: What were my role in my previous position. How did I hear about Morehouse School of Medicine. What were my academic and career roles. What was some challenges I experienced during my undergraduate studies. Why did I apply to Morehouse School of Medicine.

title: Research Associate Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine
Interview Descriptions: My initial interview was very positive and resulted in a long-term positive job experience overall.
Interview Questions: Describe various method of program evaluation for community-based health promotion programs?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is relaxing and friendly not intimidating at all. You interview with people in the department you will be working in. They conduct one-on-one interviews; no panel interviews. Once you have completed the interview process, someone from the Human Resource department will contact you if you have been selected for the job.
Interview Questions: How would you handling working with multiple people?

title: Administrative Assistant II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Morehouse School of Medicine (Atlanta, GA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Interview process were general questions like how you fit the position, tell me about yourself, etc.
Interview Questions: Most questions asked were average questions
